item.title: Kate add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Hold thy peace, dear little Pearl!" whispered her mother. "We must not always talk in the market-place of what happens to us in the forest." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Kate add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Happiness is like a butterfly which, when pursued, is always beyond our grasp, but, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Kate add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "It is a curious subject of observation and inquiry, whether hatred and love be not the same thing at bottom. Each, in its utmost development, supposes a high degree of intimacy and heart-knowledge; each renders one individual dependent for the food of his affections and spiritual life upon another; each leaves the passionate lover, or the no less passionate hater, forlorn and desolate by the withdrawal of his object." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Kate add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "America is now wholly given over to a damned mob of scribbling women, and I should have no chance of success while the public taste is occupied with their trash." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Kate add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "And there I sat, long long ago, waiting for the world to know me." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Kate add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Sometimes they would sit in the parlor together, both reading â€“ in entirely separate worlds, to be sure, but joined somehow. When this happened, other people in the family couldn't bring themselves to disturb them. All that could be heard in the parlor was the sound of pages, turning." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Kate add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Some things you cannot wish away or think away. They become part of you when you remember them." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Kate add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Sometimes words drew blood, they cut your tongue, they made you know things you couldn't unknow. " -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Kate add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Still, I couldn't help but wonder if it was a mistake for people like us to be tied to a place. If we weren't meant to be ready and willing to wander. If everything we needed was contained in who we were. And what we remember." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Kate add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "When all is said and done, the weather and love are the two elements about which one can never be sure." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Kate add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Some stories stayed with you even when you wanted to forget them." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Kate add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "...if anyone bothered to search through the laurel bordering the asphalt he'd surely find handfuls of teeth that were said to give the laurel its odd milky color, ivory with a pale pink edge, each blossom forming the shape of a bitter man's mouth." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Kate add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Never look at other people's bad fortune,' my mother said. 'If you do, it will come back to find you instead of its rightful owner." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Kate add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Let everyone see the blood,' he said. 'Don't clean it up. That's the only way people remember.'... I could see the blood inside my head. It was with me forever, whether or not I wanted to forget." -- Alice Hoffman
